_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



VWR International, headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, is a global laboratory supply and distribution company. VWR is ready to support your production facility with reliable access to raw materials and essential supplies; provide innovative, high quality products for life science labs; provide products and processes in the healthcare industry; supply enhanced access to over 100,000 Safety & Industrial Supplies; provide a selected portfolio specifically designed to help prevent potential contamination and maintain aseptic conditions in cleanrooms and controlled environments; provide lab furniture; and provide comprehensive information and services on chromatography instruments, software, and consumables for a wide variety of chromatography techniques and applications.



The VWR International management is not only committed to offering superior supplies and

services, but also to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. VWR International's safety and environmental policies are administered by the Distribution Manager with the assistance from the Regulatory Affairs and Environmental Health & Safety Manager, who all conduct periodic inspections of the facility to ensure compliance, and will oversee the entire safety and environmental programs, including the RMP Program.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



VWR is located at 12350 Southwest Tualatin Road #B, in Tualatin, Oregon. The facility is approximately 0.16 miles southeast of State Highway 99. The area immediately surrounding the facility is urban with a mixture of commercial, industrial, and residential areas. The primary business of VWR International is a chemical storage/distribution facility. All materials are in solutions of less than 50% with water. The chemicals are stored in 55 gallon drums. The containers are delivered by freight compani

es. The containers remain onsite until they are purchased by a customer, at which point they are picked up for delivery to the client.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION

STEPS



In order to operate the storage and distribution facility, VWR International complies with the EPA Risk Management Program. In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed. The facility is also ISO 9001 certified.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



The facility has not had any accidents or releases or regulated substances from covered processes over the past five years (November 2010 - November 2015) that exceeded the Federal Reportable Quantities for hazardous chemicals or the state requirement mandating immediate reporting of any release or threatened release of a hazardous chemical. In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from a release of a regulated substance.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The Hazard Review, performed on November 11, 2015, generated mitigation measures (recommendations) to improve safety at the VWR International facility located in Tualatin, Oregon.The mitigation measure include additional training, key maintenance-related tests/inspections, enhanced emergency response policies and procedures. The VWR International safety committee is planning to complete several items, including the recommendations, over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees. These changes include the following items:



- Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety/Plan Programs.

- Continue to have employee involvement in Safety/Plan development.

- Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.

- Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.

- Recommendation tracking for the technical studies is maintained by the Environmental, health, Safe
